turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Verallia North America.
turn.1: What is the difference between Verallia North America and other glass packaging brands?
turn.2: Verallia North America Verallia North America formerly the North American division of Verallia, is a glass packaging brand of the multinational company Ardagh Group.
turn.4: It produces more than nine billion glass bottles and jars per year, from thirteen plants located throughout the United States and is headquartered in Muncie, Indiana.
turn.6: Verallia North America can trace its roots in the United States back to 1842 when Joseph Foster started a glass factory in Stoddard, New Hampshire.
turn.8: This factory later grew into the Foster-Forbes Glass Company.
turn.9: Did anyone else play a role in the growth?
turn.10: In 1886 the Ball Brothers Glass Manufacturing Company became the Ball Corporation.
turn.12: In 1995, the two U.S. glass companies merged to become Ball-Foster Glass Container Company and formed a joint venture with Saint-Gobain.
